hw2

Class TennisGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw2.TennisGame

  • public class TennisGame
extends java.lang.Object
    Simulates and scores a game of tennis with two players, a server and a receiver.
    Author:
    Max Van de Wille

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TennisGame()
      Creates a new TennisGame where both players will start with 0 points and the ball starts off not in play.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BallDirection getBallStatus()
      Returns the direction of the ball
      java.lang.String getCallString()
      Returns the score of the game using conventional tennis rules
      int getReceiverPoints()
      Returns the raw score for the receiver
      java.lang.String getScore()
      Returns the score of the game using each player's raw score
      int getServerPoints()
      Returns the raw score for the server
      void hit(boolean fault, boolean headedOutOfBounds)
      This method simulates a hit from either the server or the receiver, with boolean parameters for if they faulted their hit or if their hit is headed out of bounds
      boolean isOver()
      Returns true if the game is over according to the rules of tennis
      void miss()
      Simulates a miss from whichever player the ball is headed towards, causing the ball to hit the ground and the rally to end
      boolean receiverWon()
      Returns true if the server has won the game
      void serve(boolean serviceFault)
      This method simulates the server serving the ball towards the receiver, with a boolean parameter for if they have faulted their serve
      boolean serverWon()
      Returns true if the server has won the game
      void setScore(int newServerScore, int newReceiverScore)
      Sets the scores for the server and receiver directly and sets ball status to not in play.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • TennisGame

        public TennisGame()
        Creates a new TennisGame where both players will start with 0 points and the ball starts off not in play.

    • Method Detail

      • setScore

        public void setScore(int newServerScore,
                     int newReceiverScore)
        Sets the scores for the server and receiver directly and sets ball status to not in play.
        Parameters:
        newServerScore - the amount of points you wish to give the server
        newReceiverScore - the amount of points you wish to give the receiver

      • getReceiverPoints

        public int getReceiverPoints()
        Returns the raw score for the receiver
        Returns:
        current number of points for the receiver

      • getServerPoints

        public int getServerPoints()
        Returns the raw score for the server
        Returns:
        current number of points for the receiver

      • getBallStatus

        public BallDirection getBallStatus()
        Returns the direction of the ball
        Returns:
        current direction of the ball (NOT_IN_PLAY, TOWARD_RECEIVER, TOWARD_SERVER)

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Returns true if the game is over according to the rules of tennis
        Returns:
        boolean value, true is game is over and false if not

      • serverWon

        public boolean serverWon()
        Returns true if the server has won the game
        Returns:
        if the server won this is true

      • receiverWon

        public boolean receiverWon()
        Returns true if the server has won the game
        Returns:
        if the receiver won this is true

      • serve

        public void serve(boolean serviceFault)
        This method simulates the server serving the ball towards the receiver, with a boolean parameter for if they have faulted their serve
        Parameters:
        serviceFault - dictates whether the server has faulted in their serve

      • hit

        public void hit(boolean fault,
                boolean headedOutOfBounds)
        This method simulates a hit from either the server or the receiver, with boolean parameters for if they faulted their hit or if their hit is headed out of bounds
        Parameters:
        fault - true if the hitter faulted on their hit
        headedOutOfBounds - true if the ball is headed out of bounds

      • miss

        public void miss()
        Simulates a miss from whichever player the ball is headed towards, causing the ball to hit the ground and the rally to end

      • getScore

        public java.lang.String getScore()
        Returns the score of the game using each player's raw score
        Returns:
        string dictating the score of the game as "server-receiver"

      • getCallString

        public java.lang.String getCallString()
        Returns the score of the game using conventional tennis rules
        Returns:
        string dictating the score of the game as "server-receiver"
